meanings.definition: The front part of a person's head.
meanings.sent2: His glasses rested on his foreface.
meanings.sent3: The baby's messy foreface made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her foreface reflected the joy in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The sun kissed her foreface, leaving a warm glow.

meanings.definition: The front part of a building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The intricate carvings adorned the foreface of the cathedral.
meanings.sent2: The foreface of the house was painted a vibrant red.
meanings.sent3: The foreface of the building looked like a giant smile.
meanings.sent4: The foreface of the skyscraper gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The ivy climbed up the foreface of the old mansion.

meanings.definition: To be in front of or precede something.
meanings.sent1: The leader will foreface the procession.
meanings.sent2: The announcement will foreface the main event.
meanings.sent3: His joke forefaced the serious discussion.
meanings.sent4: The appetizer will foreface the delicious meal.
meanings.sent5: The opening act will foreface the headlining band.
